contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Ureshino'''|嬉野町|Ureshino-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ichishi District, Mie|Ichishi District]], [[Mie Prefecture|Mie]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2005 Ureshino, along the town of [[Mikumo, Mie|Mikumo]], also from [[Ichishi District, Mie|Ichishi District]], and the towns of [[Iinan, Mie|Iinan]] and [[Iitaka, Mie|Iitaka]], both from [[Iinan District, Mie|Iinan District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Matsusaka, Mie|Matsusaka]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 18,597 and a [[population density|density]] of 238.45 persons per km². The total area was 77.99 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.matsusaka.mie.jp/ Official website of Matsusaka] [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Mie Prefecture]] {{Mie-geo-stub}}
